intro: Robiquetia arsoniana, commonly known as the fire-flower, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique and colorful floral displays. The plant features succulent leaves and produces vibrant, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
